symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Avatar
symbols.description:
Overview

An image-like control that has different display options for representing images and icons in different shapes and sizes, depending on the use case. The shape can be circular or square. There are several predefined sizes, as well as an option to set a custom size.

ES6 Module Import

import @ui5/webcomponents/dist/Avatar.js";

properties.name: accessibleName
properties.description: Defines the text alternative of the ui5-avatar. If not provided a default text alternative will be set, if present.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description:
Defines the background color of the desired image.

Available options are:
  • Accent1
  • Accent2
  • Accent3
  • Accent4
  • Accent5
  • Accent6
  • Accent7
  • Accent8
  • Accent9
  • Accent10
  • Placeholder

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Defines the name of the UI5 Icon, that would be displayed.
Note: If image is set, the property would be ignored.
Note: You should import the desired icon first, then use its name as "icon".

import "@ui5/webcomponents-icons/dist/icons/{icon_name}.js" 
<ui5-avatar icon-src="employee">
See all the available icons in the Icon Explorer.

properties.name: image
properties.description: Defines the source path to the desired image.

properties.name: imageFitType
properties.description:
Defines the fit type of the desired image.

Available options are:
  • Cover
  • Contain

properties.name: initials
properties.description:
Defines the displayed initials.
Up to two Latin letters can be displayed as initials in a ui5-avatar.

properties.name: shape
properties.description:
Defines the shape of the ui5-avatar.

Available options are:
  • Circle
  • Square

properties.name: size
properties.description:
Defines predefined size of the ui5-avatar.

Available options are:
  • XS
  • S
  • M
  • L
  • XL

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Badge
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-badge is a small non-interactive component which contains text information and color chosen from a list of predefined color schemes. It serves the purpose to attract the user attention to some piece of information (state, quantity, condition, etc.).

Usage Guidelines

  • If the text is longer than the width of the component, it doesn’t wrap, it shows ellipsis.
  • When truncated, the full text is not visible, therefore, it’s recommended to make more space for longer texts to be fully displayed.
  • Colors are not semantic and have no visual representation in High Contrast Black (sap_belize_hcb) theme.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Badge";

properties.name: colorScheme
properties.description:
Defines the color scheme of the ui5-badge. There are 10 predefined schemes. Each scheme applies different values for the background-color and border-color. To use one you can set a number from "1" to "10". The colorScheme "1" will be set by default.

Note: Color schemes have no visual representation in High Contrast Black (sap_belize_hcb) theme.

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the text of the ui5-badge.
Note: Аlthough this slot accepts HTML Elements, it is strongly recommended that you only use text in order to preserve the intended design.

slots.name: icon
slots.description: Defines the ui5-icon to be displayed in the ui5-badge.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.BusyIndicator
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-busyindicator signals that some operation is going on and that the user must wait. It does not block the current UI screen so other operations could be triggered in parallel.

Usage

For the ui5-busyindicator you can define the size of the indicator, as well as whether it is shown or hidden. In order to hide it, use the html attribute hidden or display: none;

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/BusyIndicator";

properties.name: active
properties.description: Defines if the busy indicator is visible on the screen. By default it is not.

properties.name: size
properties.description:
Defines the size of the ui5-busyindicator.

Note: Available options are "Small", "Medium", and "Large".

properties.name: text
properties.description: Defines text to be displayed below the busy indicator. It can be used to inform the user of the current operation.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Determines the content over which the ui5-busyindicator will appear.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Button
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-button component represents a simple push button. It enables users to trigger actions by clicking or tapping the ui5-button, or by pressing certain keyboard keys, such as Enter.

Usage

For the ui5-button UI, you can define text, icon, or both. You can also specify whether the text or the icon is displayed first.

You can choose from a set of predefined types that offer different styling to correspond to the triggered action.

You can set the ui5-button as enabled or disabled. An enabled ui5-button can be pressed by clicking or tapping it. The button changes its style to provide visual feedback to the user that it is pressed or hovered over with the mouse cursor. A disabled ui5-button appears inactive and cannot be pressed.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Button";

properties.name: design
properties.description:
Defines the ui5-button design.

Note: Available options are "Default", "Emphasized", "Positive", "Negative", and "Transparent".

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Defines whether the ui5-button is disabled (default is set to false). A disabled ui5-button can't be pressed or focused, and it is not in the tab chain.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Defines the icon to be displayed as graphical element within the ui5-button. The SAP-icons font provides numerous options.

Example: 
ui5-button icon="palette"
See all the available icons in the Icon Explorer.

properties.name: iconEnd
properties.description: Defines whether the icon should be displayed after the ui5-button text.

properties.name: submits
properties.description:
When set to true, the ui5-button will automatically submit the nearest form element upon press.

Important: For the submits property to have effect, you must add the following import to your project: import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputElementsFormSupport.js";

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the text of the ui5-button.

Note: Аlthough this slot accepts HTML Elements, it is strongly recommended that you only use text in order to preserve the intended design.

events.name: click
events.description:
Fired when the ui5-button is activated either with a mouse/tap or by using the Enter or Space key.

Note: The event will not be fired if the disabled property is set to true.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Calendar
symbols.description: The ui5-calendar can be used standale to display the years, months, weeks and days, but the main purpose of the ui5-calendar is to be used within a ui5-datepicker.

properties.name: maxDate
properties.description: Determines the maximum date available for selection.

properties.name: minDate
properties.description: Determines the мinimum date available for selection.

properties.name: primaryCalendarType
properties.description: Defines the calendar type used for display. If not defined, the calendar type of the global configuration is used. Available options are: "Gregorian", "Islamic", "Japanese", "Buddhist" and "Persian".

properties.name: selectedDates
properties.description: Defines the selected dates as UTC timestamps.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: Defines the UNIX timestamp - seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on Jan 1, 1970.

events.name: selectedDatesChange

parameters.name: dates
parameters.description: The selected dates' timestamps

events.description: Fired when the selected dates changed.

methods.name: isInValidRange
methods.description: Checks if a date is in range between minimum and maximum date

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Card
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-card is a component that represents information in the form of a tile with separate header and content areas. The content area of a ui5-card can be arbitrary HTML content. The header can be used through several properties, such as: heading, subheading, status and a slot: avatar.

Keyboard handling

In case you enable headerInteractive property, you can press the ui5-card header by Space and Enter keys.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Card";

properties.name: headerInteractive
properties.description: Defines if the ui5-card header would be interactive, e.g gets hover effect, gets focused and headerPress event is fired, when it is pressed.

properties.name: heading
properties.description: Defines the title displayed in the ui5-card header.

properties.name: status
properties.description: Defines the status displayed in the ui5-card header.

properties.name: subheading
properties.description: Defines the subheading displayed in the ui5-card header.

slots.name: avatar
slots.description:
Defines the visual representation in the header of the card. Supports images and icons.

Note: SAP-icons font provides numerous options. To find all the available icons, see the Icon Explorer.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Defines the content of the ui5-card.

events.name: headerClick
events.description:
Fired when the ui5-card header is activated by mouse/tap or by using the Enter or Space key.

Note: The event would be fired only if the headerInteractive property is set to true.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Carousel
symbols.description:
Overview

The carousel allows the user to browse through a set of items by swiping right or left. The component is mostly used for showing a gallery of images, but can hold any other HTML element.

Usage

When to use - The items you want to display are very different from each other. - You want to display the items one after the other. When not to use - The items you want to display need to be visible at the same time. - The items you want to display are uniform and very similar For the ui5-carousel

ES6 Module Import

import @ui5/webcomponents/dist/Carousel.js";

properties.name: arrowsPlacement
properties.description:
Defines the position of arrows.

Available options are:
  • Content
  • Navigation

When set to "Content", the arrows are placed on the sides of the current page.
When set to "Navigation", the arrows are placed on the sides of the page indicator.

properties.name: cyclic
properties.description: Defines whether the carousel should loop, i.e show the first page after the last page is reached and vice versa.

properties.name: hideNavigation
properties.description: If set to true the navigation is hidden.

properties.name: itemsPerPageL
properties.description: Sets the number of items per page on large size (more than 1024px). One item per page shown by default.

properties.name: itemsPerPageM
properties.description: Sets the number of items per page on medium size (from 640px to 1024px). One item per page shown by default.

properties.name: itemsPerPageS
properties.description: Sets the number of items per page on small size (up to 640px). One item per page shown by default.

properties.name: selectedIndex
properties.description: Defines the index of the initially selected item.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Defines the content of the ui5-carousel.

events.name: navigate

parameters.name: selectedIndex
parameters.description: the current selectedIndex.

events.description: Fired whenever the selectedIndex changes due to user interaction, when the user clicks on the navigation arrows or while resizing, based on the items-per-page-l, items-per-page-m and items-per-page-s properties.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.CheckBox
symbols.description:
Overview

Allows the user to set a binary value, such as true/false or yes/no for an item.

The ui5-checkbox component consists of a box and a label that describes its purpose. If it's checked, an indicator is displayed inside the box. To check/uncheck the ui5-checkbox, the user has to click or tap the square box or its label.

The ui5-checkbox component only has 2 states - checked and unchecked. Clicking or tapping toggles the ui5-checkbox between checked and unchecked state.

Usage

You can manually set the width of the element containing the box and the label using the width property. If the text exceeds the available width, it is truncated. The touchable area for toggling the ui5-checkbox ends where the text ends.

You can disable the ui5-checkbox by setting the disabled property to true, or use the ui5-checkbox in read-only mode by setting the readonly property to true.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/CheckBox";

properties.name: checked
properties.description:
Defines if the ui5-checkbox is checked.

Note: The property can be changed with user interaction, either by cliking/tapping on the ui5-checkbox, or by pressing the Enter or Space key.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description:
Defines whether the ui5-checkbox is disabled.

Note: A disabled ui5-checkbox is completely noninteractive.

properties.name: name
properties.description:
Determines the name with which the ui5-checkbox will be submitted in an HTML form.

Important: For the name property to have effect, you must add the following import to your project: import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputElementsFormSupport.js";

Note: When set, a native input HTML element will be created inside the ui5-checkbox so that it can be submitted as part of an HTML form. Do not use this property unless you need to submit a form.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description:
Defines whether the ui5-checkbox is read-only.

Note: A red-only ui5-checkbox is not editable, but still provides visual feedback upon user interaction.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Defines the text of the ui5-checkbox.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Defines the value state of the ui5-checkbox.

Note: Available options are Warning, Error, and None (default).

properties.name: wrap
properties.description:
Defines whether the ui5-checkbox text wraps when there is not enough space.

Note: By default, the text truncates when there is not enough space.

events.name: change
events.description: Fired when the ui5-checkbox checked state changes.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.ComboBox
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-combobox component represents a drop-down menu with a list of the available options and a text input field to narrow down the options. It is commonly used to enable users to select one or more options from a predefined list.

Structure

The ui5-combobox consists of the following elements:
  • Input field - displays the selected option or a custom user entry. Users can type to narrow down the list or enter their own value.
  • Drop-down arrow - expands\collapses the option list.
  • Option list - the list of available options.

Keyboard Handling

The ui5-combobox provides advanced keyboard handling.

Picker

If the ui5-combobox is focused, you can open or close the drop-down by pressing F4, ALT+UP or ALT+DOWN keys.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/ComboBox";

properties.name: disabled
properties.description:
Defines whether ui5-combobox is in disabled state.

Note: A disabled ui5-combobox is completely uninteractive.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: Defines the filter type of the ui5-combobox. Available options are: StartsWithPerTerm, StartsWith and Contains.

properties.name: filterValue
properties.description:
Defines the "live" value of the ui5-combobox.

Note: The property is updated upon typing.

Note: Initially the filter value is synced with value.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Indicates whether a loading indicator should be shown in the picker.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the ui5-combobox has no value.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description:
Defines whether the ui5-combobox is readonly.

Note: A read-only ui5-combobox is not editable, but still provides visual feedback upon user interaction.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Defines whether the ui5-combobox is required.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Defines the value of the ui5-combobox.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Defines the value state of the ui5-combobox.

Available options are:
  • None
  • Error
  • Warning
  • Success
  • Information

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the ui5-combobox items.

Example:
<ui5-combobox>
    <ui5-li>Item #1</ui5-li>
    <ui5-li>Item #2</ui5-li>
</ui5-combobox>

events.name: change
events.description: Fired when the input operation has finished by pressing Enter, focusout or an item is selected.

events.name: input
events.description:
Fired when typing in input.

Note: filterValue property is updated, input is changed.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.ComboBoxItem
symbols.description: The ui5-cb-item represents the item for a ui5-combobox.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Defines the text of the ui5-cb-item.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.CustomListItem
symbols.description: A component to be used as custom list item within the ui5-list the same way as the standard ui5-li. The ui5-li-custom accepts arbitrary HTML content to allow full customization.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Defines the content of the ui5-li-custom.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.DatePicker
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-datepicker component provides an input field with assigned calendar which opens on user action. The ui5-datepicker allows users to select a localized date using touch, mouse, or keyboard input. It consists of two parts: the date input field and the date picker.

Usage

The user can enter a date by:
  • Using the calendar that opens in a popup
  • Typing it in directly in the input field


When the user makes an entry and chooses the enter key, the calendar shows the corresponding date. When the user directly triggers the calendar display, the actual date is displayed.

Formatting

If a date is entered by typing it into the input field, it must fit to the used date format.

Supported format options are pattern-based on Unicode LDML Date Format notation. For more information, see UTS #35: Unicode Locale Data Markup Language.

For example, if the format-pattern is "yyyy-MM-dd", a valid value string is "2015-07-30" and the same is displayed in the input.

Keyboard Handling

The ui5-datepicker provides advanced keyboard handling. If the ui5-datepicker is focused, you can open or close the drop-down by pressing F4, ALT+UP or ALT+DOWN keys. Once the drop-down is opened, you can use the UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT arrow keys to navigate through the dates and select one by pressing the Space or Enter keys. Moreover you can use TAB to reach the buttons for changing month and year.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/DatePicker";

properties.name: dateValue
properties.description: Currently selected date represented as JavaScript Date instance.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Determines whether the ui5-datepicker is displayed as disabled.

properties.name: formatPattern
properties.description: Determines the format, displayed in the input field.

properties.name: maxDate
properties.description: Determines the maximum date available for selection.

properties.name: minDate
properties.description: Determines the minimum date available for selection.

properties.name: name
properties.description:
Determines the name with which the ui5-datepicker will be submitted in an HTML form.

Important: For the name property to have effect, you must add the following import to your project: import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputElementsFormSupport.js";

Note: When set, a native input HTML element will be created inside the ui5-datepicker so that it can be submitted as part of an HTML form. Do not use this property unless you need to submit a form.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description:
Defines a short hint, intended to aid the user with data entry when the ui5-datepicker has no value.

Note: When no placeholder is set, the format pattern is displayed as a placeholder. Passing an empty string as the value of this property will make the ui5-datepicker appear empty - without placeholder or format pattern.

properties.name: primaryCalendarType
properties.description:
Determines the calendar type. The input value is formated according to the calendar type and the picker shows the months and years from the specified calendar.

Available options are:
  • Gregorian
  • Islamic
  • Japanese
  • Buddhist
  • Persian

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: Determines whether the ui5-datepicker is displayed as read-only.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Defines a formatted date value.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Defines the value state of the ui5-datepicker.

Available options are:
  • None
  • Error
  • Warning
  • Success
  • Information

events.name: change
events.description: Fired when the input operation has finished by pressing Enter or on focusout.

events.name: input
events.description: Fired when the value of the ui5-datepicker is changed at each key stroke.

methods.name: isInValidRange
methods.description: Checks if a date is in range between minimum and maximum date.

methods.name: isOpen

returnValue.description: true if the picker is open, false otherwise

methods.description: Checks if the picker is open.

methods.name: isValid

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: A value to be tested against the current date format

methods.description: Checks if a value is valid against the current date format of the DatePicker.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
A JSON object with additional configuration.
{ focusInput: true } By default, the focus goes in the picker after opening it. Specify this option to focus the input field.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.DateTimePicker
symbols.description:
Overview

The DateTimePicker component alows users to select both date (day, month and year) and time (hours, minutes and seconds) and for the purpose it consists of input field and Date/Time picker.

Usage

Use the DateTimePicker if you need a combined date and time input component. Don't use it if you want to use either date, or time value. In this case, use the DatePicker or the TimePicker components instead.

The user can set date/time by:
  • using the calendar and the time selectors
  • typing in the input field
Programatically, to set date/time for the DateTimePicker, use the value property

As most of the input based components, the DateTimePicker supports properties, such as: disabled, readonly, valueState and placeholder.

Formatting

The value entered by typing into the input field must fit to the used date/time format.

Supported format options are pattern-based on Unicode LDML Date Format notation. For more information, see UTS #35: Unicode Locale Data Markup Language.

Example: the following format dd/MM/yyyy, hh:mm:ss aa corresponds the 13/04/2020, 03:16:16 AM value.
The small 'h' defines "12" hours format and the "aa" symbols - "AM/PM" time periods.

Example: the following format dd/MM/yyyy, HH:mm:ss corresponds the 13/04/2020, 15:16:16 value.
The capital 'H' indicates "24" hours format.

Note: If the formatPattern does NOT include time, the DateTimePicker will fallback to the default time format according to the locale.

Note: If no placeholder is set to the DateTimePicker, the current formatPattern is displayed as a placeholder. If another placeholder is needed, it must be set or in case no placeholder is needed - it can be set to an empty string.

Note: If the user input does NOT match the formatPattern, the DateTimePicker makes an attempt to parse it based on the locale settings.

Responsive behavior

The DateTimePicker is responsive and fully adapts to all devices. For larger screens, such as tablet or desktop, it is displayed as a popover, while on phone devices, it is displayed full screen.

ES6 Module Import

import @ui5/webcomponents/dist/DateTimePicker.js";

methods.name: isValid

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: A value to be tested against the current date/time format

methods.description: Checks if a value is valid against the current date/time format.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
A JSON object with additional configuration.
{ focusInput: true } By default, the focus goes in the picker after opening it. Specify this option to focus the input field.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.DayPicker
symbols.description: Represents one month view inside a calendar.

properties.name: formatPattern
properties.description: Determines the format, displayed in the input field.

properties.name: maxDate
properties.description: Determines the maximum date available for selection.

properties.name: minDate
properties.description: Determines the мinimum date available for selection.

properties.name: primaryCalendarType
properties.description: Sets a calendar type used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

properties.name: selectedDates
properties.description: Sets the selected dates as UTC timestamps.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: A UNIX timestamp - seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on Jan 1, 1970.

events.name: navigate
events.description: Fired when month, year has changed due to item navigation.

events.name: selectionChange
events.description: Fired when the user selects a new Date on the Web Component.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Dialog
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-dialog component is used to temporarily display some information in a size-limited window in front of the regular app screen. It is used to prompt the user for an action or a confirmation. The ui5-dialog interrupts the current app processing as it is the only focused UI element and the main screen is dimmed/blocked. The dialog combines concepts known from other technologies where the windows have names such as dialog box, dialog window, pop-up, pop-up window, alert box, or message box.

The ui5-dialog is modal, which means that user action is required before returning to the parent window is possible. The content of the ui5-dialog is fully customizable.

Structure

A ui5-dialog consists of a header, content, and a footer for action buttons. The ui5-dialog is usually displayed at the center of the screen.

Responsive Behavior

The stretch property can be used to stretch the ui5-dialog on full screen.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Dialog";

properties.name: stretch
properties.description:
Determines whether the ui5-dialog should be stretched to fullscreen.

Note: The ui5-dialog will be stretched to aproximetly 90% of the viewport.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.DurationPicker
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-duration-picker component provides an input field with assigned sliders which opens on user action. The ui5-duration-picker allows users to select a time duration. It consists of two parts: the time input field and the sliders.

Usage

The Duration Picker is used for input of time. Users are able to select hours, minutes and seconds. The user can enter a time by:
  • Using the sliders that opens in a popup
  • Typing it in directly in the input field


When the user makes an entry and chooses the enter key, the sliders shows the corresponding time. When the user directly triggers the sliders display, the actual time is displayed. For the ui5-duration-picker

ES6 Module Import

import @ui5/webcomponents/dist/DurationPicker.js";

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Determines whether the ui5-duration-picker is displayed as disabled.

properties.name: maxValue
properties.description: Defines a formatted maximal time that the user will be able to adjust.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: Determines whether the ui5-duration-picker is displayed as readonly.

properties.name: showSeconds
properties.description: Defines whether a slider for secconds will be available. By default there are sliders for hours and minutes only.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Defines a formatted time value.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Visualizes the validation state of the Web Component, for example Error, Warning and Success.
  • None
  • Error
  • Warning
  • Success
  • Information

events.name: change
events.description: Fired when the input operation has finished by pressing Enter or on focusout.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.FileUploader
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-file-uploader opens a file explorer dialog and enables users to upload files. The component consists of input field, but you can provide an HTML element by your choice to trigger the file upload, by using the default slot. Furthermore, you can set the property "hideInput" to "true" to hide the input field.
To get all selected files, you can simply use the read-only "files" property. To restrict the types of files the user can select, you can use the "accept" property.
And, similar to all input based components, the FileUploader supports "valueState", "placeholder", "name", and "disabled" properties. For the ui5-file-uploader

ES6 Module Import

import @ui5/webcomponents/dist/FileUploader.js";

properties.name: accept
properties.description: Comma-separated list of file types that the ui5-file-uploader should accept.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description:
Defines whether ui5-file-uploader is in disabled state.

Note: A disabled ui5-file-uploader is completely noninteractive.

properties.name: files
properties.description: FileList of all selected files.

properties.name: hideInput
properties.description: If set to "true", the input field of ui5-file-uploader will not be rendered. Only the default slot that is passed will be rendered.

properties.name: multiple
properties.description: Allows multiple files to be chosen.

properties.name: name
properties.description:
Determines the name with which the ui5-file-uploader will be submitted in an HTML form.

Important: For the name property to have effect, you must add the following import to your project: import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputElementsFormSupport.js";

Note: When set, a native input HTML element will be created inside the ui5-file-uploader so that it can be submitted as part of an HTML form. Do not use this property unless you need to submit a form.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the ui5-file-uploader has no value.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Defines the name/names of the file/files to upload.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Defines the value state of the ui5-file-uploader.

Available options are:
  • None
  • Error
  • Warning
  • Success
  • Information

slots.name: default
slots.description: By default the ui5-file-uploader contains a single input field. With this slot you can pass any content that you wish to add. See the samples for more information.

events.name: change

parameters.name: files
parameters.description: The current files.

events.description: Event is fired when the value of the file path has been changed. Note: Keep in mind that because of the HTML input element of type file, the event is also fired in Chrome browser when the Cancel button of the uploads window is pressed.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.GroupHeaderListItem
symbols.description: The ui5-li-group-header is a special list item, used only to separate other list items into logical groups.

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the text of the ui5-li-groupheader.
Note: Аlthough this slot accepts HTML Elements, it is strongly recommended that you only use text in order to preserve the intended design.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Icon
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-icon component represents an SVG icon. There are two main scenarios how the ui5-icon component is used: as a purely decorative element; or as a visually appealing clickable area in the form of an icon button.

A large set of built-in icons is available and they can be used by setting the name property on the ui5-icon.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Icon.js";

properties.name: accessibleName
properties.description:
Defines the text alternative of the ui5-icon. If not provided a default text alternative will be set, if present.

Note: Every icon should have a text alternative in order to calculate its accessible name.

properties.name: name
properties.description:
Defines the unique identifier (icon name) of each ui5-icon.

To browse all available icons, see the Icon Explorer.

Example:
name='add', name='delete', name='employee'.

properties.name: showTooltip
properties.description: Defines whether the ui5-icon should have a tooltip.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Input
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-input component allows the user to enter and edit text or numeric values in one line.
Additionally, you can provide suggestionItems, that are displayed in a popover right under the input.

The text field can be editable or read-only (readonly property), and it can be enabled or disabled (enabled property). To visualize semantic states, such as "error" or "warning", the valueState property is provided. When the user makes changes to the text, the change event is fired, which enables you to react on any text change.

Note: If you are using the ui5-input as a single npm module, don't forget to import the InputSuggestions module from "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputSuggestions.js" to enable the suggestions functionality.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Input.js";
import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputSuggestions.js"; (optional - for input suggestions support)

properties.name: disabled
properties.description:
Defines whether the ui5-input is in disabled state.

Note: A disabled ui5-input is completely noninteractive.

properties.name: maxlength
properties.description: Sets the maximum number of characters available in the input field.

properties.name: name
properties.description:
Determines the name with which the ui5-input will be submitted in an HTML form.

Important: For the name property to have effect, you must add the following import to your project: import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputElementsFormSupport.js";

Note: When set, a native input HTML element will be created inside the ui5-input so that it can be submitted as part of an HTML form. Do not use this property unless you need to submit a form.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the ui5-input has no value.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description:
Defines whether the ui5-input is read-only.

Note: A read-only ui5-input is not editable, but still provides visual feedback upon user interaction.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Defines whether the ui5-input is required.

properties.name: showSuggestions
properties.description:
Defines whether the ui5-input should show suggestions, if such are present.

Note: Don`t forget to import the InputSuggestions module from "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputSuggestions.js" to enable this functionality.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
Defines the HTML type of the ui5-input. Available options are: Text, Email, Number, Password, Tel, and URL.

Notes:
  • The particular effect of this property differs depending on the browser and the current language settings, especially for type Number.
  • The property is mostly intended to be used with touch devices that use different soft keyboard layouts depending on the given input type.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
Defines the value of the ui5-input.

Note: The property is updated upon typing.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Defines the value state of the ui5-input.

Available options are:
  • None
  • Error
  • Warning
  • Success
  • Information

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the ui5-input suggestion items.

Example:

<ui5-input show-suggestions>
    <ui5-suggestion-item text="Item #1"></ui5-suggestion-item>
    <ui5-suggestion-item text="Item #2"></ui5-suggestion-item>
</ui5-input>


Note: The suggestion would be displayed only if the showSuggestions property is set to true.

Note: The <ui5-suggestion-item> is recommended to be used as a suggestion item. Importing the Input Suggestions Support feature:
import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputSuggestions.js";
also automatically imports the <ui5-suggestion-item> for your convenience.

slots.name: icon
slots.description: Defines the icon to be displayed in the ui5-input.

slots.name: valueStateMessage
slots.description:
Defines the value state message that will be displayed as pop up under the ui5-input.

Note: If not specified, a default text (in the respective language) will be displayed.
Note: The valueStateMessage would be displayed, when the ui5-input is in Information, Warning or Error value state.
Note: If the ui5-input has suggestionItems, the valueStateMessage would be displayed as part of the same popover, if used on desktop, or dialog - on phone.

events.name: change
events.description: Fired when the input operation has finished by pressing Enter or on focusout.

events.name: input
events.description: Fired when the value of the ui5-input changes at each keystroke, and when a suggestion item has been selected.

events.name: submit
events.description:
Fired when user presses Enter key on the ui5-input.

Note: The event is fired independent of whether there was a change before or not. If change was performed, the event is fired after the change event. The event is also fired when an item of the select list is selected by pressing Enter.

events.name: suggestionItemSelect

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The selected item

events.description: Fired when a suggestion item, that is displayed in the suggestion popup, is selected.

methods.name: isOpen

returnValue.description: true if the popover is open, false otherwise

methods.description: Checks if the popover is open.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Label
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-label is a component used to represent a label, providing valuable information to the user. Usually it is placed next to a value holder, such as a text field. It informs the user about what data is displayed or expected in the value holder.

The ui5-label appearance can be influenced by properties, such as required and wrap. The appearance of the Label can be configured in a limited way by using the design property. For a broader choice of designs, you can use custom styles.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Label";

properties.name: for
properties.description:
Defines the labeled input by providing its ID.

Note: Can be used with both ui5-input and native input.

properties.name: required
properties.description:
Defines whether an asterisk character is added to the ui5-label text.

Note: Usually indicates that user input is required.

properties.name: showColon
properties.description:
Defines whether semi-colon is added to the ui5-label text.

Note: Usually used in forms.

properties.name: wrap
properties.description:
Determines whether the ui5-label should wrap, when there is not enough space.

Note: By default the text would truncate.

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the text of the ui5-label.
Note: Аlthough this slot accepts HTML Elements, it is strongly recommended that you only use text in order to preserve the intended design.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Link
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-link is a hyperlink component that is used to navigate to other apps and web pages, or to trigger actions. It is a clickable text element, visualized in such a way that it stands out from the standard text. On hover, it changes its style to an underlined text to provide additional feedback to the user.

Usage

You can set the ui5-link to be enabled or disabled.

To create a visual hierarchy in large lists of links, you can set the less important links as Subtle or the more important ones as Emphasized, by using the design property.

If the href property is set, the link behaves as the basic HTML anchor tag () and opens the specified URL in the given target frame (target property). To specify where the linked content is opened, you can use the target property.

Responsive behavior

If there is not enough space, the text of the ui5-link becomes truncated. If the wrap property is set to true, the text is displayed on several lines instead of being truncated.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Link";

properties.name: design
properties.description:
Defines the ui5-link design.

Note: Avaialble options are Default, Subtle, and Emphasized.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description:
Defines whether the ui5-link is disabled.

Note: When disabled, the ui5-link cannot be triggered by the user.

properties.name: href
properties.description:
Defines the ui5-link href.

Note: Standard hyperlink behavior is supported.

properties.name: target
properties.description:
Defines the ui5-link target.

Notes:
  • Available options are the standard values: _self, _top, _blank, _parent, and _search.
  • This property must only be used when the href property is set.

properties.name: wrap
properties.description:
Defines whether the ui5-link text should wrap when there is no sufficient space.

Note: The text is truncated by default.

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the text of the ui5-link.
Note: Аlthough this slot accepts HTML Elements, it is strongly recommended that you only use text in order to preserve the intended design.

events.name: click
events.description: Fired when the ui5-link is triggered either with a mouse/tap or by using the Enter key.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.List
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-list component allows displaying a list of items, advanced keyboard handling support for navigating between items, and predefined modes to improve the development efficiency.

The ui5-list is а container for the available list items:
  • ui5-li
  • ui5-li-custom
  • ui5-li-group-header


To benefit from the built-in selection mechanism, you can use the available selection modes, such as SingleSelect, MultiSelect and Delete.

Additionally, the ui5-list provides header, footer, and customization for the list item separators.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/List.js";
import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/StandardListItem.js"; (for ui5-li)
import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/CustomListItem.js"; (for ui5-li-custom)
import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/GroupHeaderListItem.js"; (for ui5-li-group-header)

properties.name: busy
properties.description: Defines if the component would display a loading indicator at the bottom of the list. It's especially useful, when combined with infiniteScroll.

properties.name: footerText
properties.description: Defines the footer text.

properties.name: headerText
properties.description:
Defines the ui5-list header text.

Note: If header is set this property is ignored.

properties.name: infiniteScroll
properties.description: Defines if the component would fire the loadMore event when the user scrolls to the bottom of the list, and helps achieving an "infinite scroll" effect by adding new items each time.

properties.name: inset
properties.description: Determines whether the list items are indented.

properties.name: mode
properties.description:
Defines the mode of the ui5-list.

Note: Avalaible options are None, SingleSelect, MultiSelect, and Delete.

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description: Defines the text that is displayed when the ui5-list contains no items.

properties.name: separators
properties.description:
Defines the item separator style that is used.

Notes:
  • Avalaible options are All, Inner, and None.
  • When set to None, none of the items are separated by horizontal lines.
  • When set to Inner, the first item doesn't have a top separator and the last item doesn't have a bottom separator.

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the items of the ui5-list.

Note: Use ui5-li, ui5-li-custom, and ui5-li-groupheader for the intended design.

slots.name: header
slots.description:
Defines the ui5-li header.

Note: When header is set, the headerText property is ignored.

events.name: itemClick

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: the clicked item.

events.description: Fired when an item is activated, unless the item's type property is set to Inactive.

events.name: itemDelete

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: the deleted item.

events.description:
Fired when the Delete button of any item is pressed.

Note: A Delete button is displayed on each item, when the ui5-list mode property is set to Delete.

events.name: loadMore
events.description:
Fired when the user scrolls to the bottom of the list.

Note: The event is fired when the infiniteScroll property is enabled.

events.name: selectionChange

parameters.name: selectedItems
parameters.description: An array of the selected items.

parameters.name: previouslySelectedItems
parameters.description: An array of the previously selected items.

events.description: Fired when selection is changed by user interaction in SingleSelect and MultiSelect modes.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.ListItem
symbols.description: A class to serve as a base for the StandardListItem and CustomListItem classes.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
Defines the visual indication and behavior of the list items. Available options are Active (by default), Inactive and Detail.

Note: When set to Active, the item will provide visual response upon press and hover, while with type Inactive and Detail - will not.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.ListItemBase
symbols.description: A class to serve as a foundation for the ListItem and GroupHeaderListItem classes.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Defines the selected state of the ListItem.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.MessageStrip
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-messagestrip component enables the embedding of app-related messages. It displays 4 types of messages, each with corresponding semantic color and icon: Information, Positive, Warning and Negative. Each message can have a Close button, so that it can be removed from the UI, if needed.

Usage

For the ui5-messagestrip component, you can define whether it displays an icon in the beginning and a close button. Moreover, its size and background can be controlled with CSS.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/MessageStrip";

properties.name: noCloseButton
properties.description: Defines whether the MessageStrip renders close icon.

properties.name: noIcon
properties.description: Defines whether the MessageStrip will show an icon in the beginning. You can directly provide an icon with the icon slot. Otherwise, the default icon for the type will be used.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
Defines the ui5-messagestrip type.

Note: Available options are "Information", "Positive", "Negative", and "Warning".

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the text of the ui5-messagestrip.

Note: Аlthough this slot accepts HTML Elements, it is strongly recommended that you only use text in order to preserve the intended design.

slots.name: icon
slots.description:
Defines the content to be displayed as graphical element within the ui5-messagestrip.

Note: If no icon is given, the default icon for the ui5-messagestrip type will be used. The SAP-icons font provides numerous options.

See all the available icons in the Icon Explorer.

events.name: close
events.description: Fired when the close button is pressed either with a click/tap or by using the Enter or Space key.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.MonthPicker
symbols.description: Displays months which can be selected.

properties.name: formatPattern
properties.description: Determines the format, displayed in the input field.

properties.name: maxDate
properties.description: Determines the maximum date available for selection.

properties.name: minDate
properties.description: Determines the мinimum date available for selection.

properties.name: primaryCalendarType
properties.description: Sets a calendar type used for display. If not set, the calendar type of the global configuration is used.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: A UNIX timestamp - seconds since 00:00:00 UTC on Jan 1, 1970.

events.name: selectedMonthChange
events.description: Fired when the user selects a new Date on the Web Component.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.MultiComboBox
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-multi-combobox component provides a list box with items and a text field allowing the user to either type a value directly into the control, or choose from the list of existing items. It is a drop-down list for selecting and filtering values, commonly used to enable users to select one or more options from a predefined list. The control provides an editable input field to filter the list, and a dropdown arrow of available options. The select options in the list have checkboxes that permit multi-selection. Entered values are displayed as tokens.

Structure

The ui5-multi-combobox consists of the following elements:
  • Tokenizer - a list of tokens with selected options.
  • Input field - displays the selected option/s as token/s. Users can type to filter the list.
  • Drop-down arrow - expands\collapses the option list.
  • Option list - the list of available options.

Keyboard Handling

The ui5-multi-combobox provides advanced keyboard handling.

Picker

If the ui5-multi-combobox is focused, you can open or close the drop-down by pressing F4, ALT+UP or ALT+DOWN keys. Once the drop-down is opened, you can use the UP and DOWN arrow keys to navigate through the available options and select one by pressing the Space or Enter keys.

Tokens

  • Left/Right arrow keys - moves the focus selection form the currently focused token to the previous/next one (if available).
  • Delete - deletes the token and focuses the previous token.
  • Backspace - deletes the token and focus the next token.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/MultiComboBox";

properties.name: allowCustomValues
properties.description: Defines if the user input will be prevented, if no matching item has been found

properties.name: disabled
properties.description:
Defines whether ui5-multi-combobox is in disabled state.

Note: A disabled ui5-multi-combobox is completely noninteractive.

properties.name: open
properties.description: Indicates whether the dropdown is open. True if the dropdown is open, false otherwise.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the ui5-multi-combobox has no value.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description:
Defines whether the ui5-multi-combobox is read-only.

Note: A read-only ui5-multi-combobox is not editable, but still provides visual feedback upon user interaction.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Defines whether the ui5-multi-combobox is required.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
Defines the value of the ui5-multi-combobox.

Note: The property is updated upon typing.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Defines the value state of the ui5-multi-combobox.

Available options are:
  • None
  • Error
  • Warning
  • Success
  • Information

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the ui5-multi-combobox items.

Example:
<ui5-multi-combobox>
    <ui5-li>Item #1</ui5-li>
    <ui5-li>Item #2</ui5-li>
</ui5-multi-combobox>

events.name: change
events.description: Fired when the input operation has finished by pressing Enter or on focusout.

events.name: input
events.description: Fired when the value of the ui5-multi-combobox changes at each keystroke.

events.name: openChange
events.description: Fired when the dropdown is opened or closed.

events.name: selectionChange

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: an array of the selected items.

events.description: Fired when selection is changed by user interaction in SingleSelect and MultiSelect modes.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.MultiComboBoxItem
symbols.description: The ui5-cb-item represents the item for a ui5-multi-combobox.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Defines the selected state of the ui5-mcb-item.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Option
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-option component defines the content of an opton in the ui5-select.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Defines the icon source URI.

Note: SAP-icons font provides numerous buil-in icons. To find all the available icons, see the Icon Explorer.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Defines the selected state of the ui5-option.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Defines the value of the ui5-select inside an HTML Form element when this ui5-option is selected. For more information on HTML Form support, see the name property of ui5-select.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Panel
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-panel component is a container which has a header and a content area and is used for grouping and displaying information. It can be collapsed to save space on the screen.

Guidelines:

  • Nesting two or more panels is not recommended.
  • Do not stack too many panels on one page.

Structure

A panel consists of a title bar with a header text or custom header.
The content area can contain an arbitrary set of controls. The header is clickable and can be used to toggle between the expanded and collapsed state. It includes an icon which rotates depending on the state.
The custom header can be set through the header slot and it may contain arbitraray content, such as: title, buttons or any other HTML elements.
Note: the custom header is not clickable out of the box, but in this case the icon is interactive and allows to show/hide the content area.

Responsive Behavior

  • If the width of the panel is set to 100% (default), the panel and its children are resized responsively, depending on its parent container.
  • If the panel has a fixed height, it will take up the space even if the panel is collapsed.
  • When the panel is expandable (the fixed property is set to false), an arrow icon (pointing to the right) appears in front of the header.
  • When the animation is activated, expand/collapse uses a smooth animation to open or close the content area.
  • When the panel expands/collapses, the arrow icon rotates 90 degrees clockwise/counter-clockwise.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Panel";

properties.name: accessibleRole
properties.description: Sets the accessible aria role of the ui5-panel. Depending on the usage, you can change the role from the default Form to Region or Complementary.

properties.name: collapsed
properties.description: Indicates whether the ui5-panel is collapsed and only the header is displayed.

properties.name: fixed
properties.description: Determines whether the ui5-panel is in a fixed state that is not expandable/collapsible by user interaction.

properties.name: headerLevel
properties.description:
Defines the "aria-level" of ui5-panel heading, set by the headerText.

Available options are: "H6" to "H1".

properties.name: headerText
properties.description:
This property is used to set the header text of the ui5-panel. The text is visible in both expanded and collapsed states.

Note: This property is overridden by the header slot.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Determines the content of the ui5-panel. The content is visible only when the ui5-panel is expanded.

slots.name: header
slots.description:
Defines the ui5-panel header area.

Note: When a header is provided, the headerText property is ignored.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Popover
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-popover component displays additional information for an object in a compact way and without leaving the page. The Popover can contain various UI elements, such as fields, tables, images, and charts. It can also include actions in the footer.

Structure

The popover has three main areas:
  • Header (optional)
  • Content
  • Footer (optional)
Note: The ui5-popover is closed when the user clicks or taps outside the popover or selects an action within the popover. You can prevent this with the modal property.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Popover.js";

properties.name: allowTargetOverlap
properties.description: Determines if there is no enough space, the ui5-popover can be placed over the target.

properties.name: headerText
properties.description:
Defines the header text.

Note: If header slot is provided, the headerText is ignored.

properties.name: horizontalAlign
properties.description:
Determines the horizontal alignment of the ui5-popover.

Available options are:
  • Center
  • Left
  • Right
  • Stretch

properties.name: initialFocus
properties.description: Defines the ID of the HTML Element, which will get the initial focus.

properties.name: modal
properties.description: Defines whether the ui5-popover should close when clicking/tapping outside of the popover. If enabled, it blocks any interaction with the background.

properties.name: noArrow
properties.description: Determines whether the ui5-popover arrow is hidden.

properties.name: placementType
properties.description:
Determines on which side the ui5-popover is placed at.

Available options are:
  • Left
  • Right
  • Top
  • Bottom

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.description:
Determines the vertical alignment of the ui5-popover.

Available options are:
  • Center
  • Top
  • Bottom
  • Stretch

slots.name: default
slots.description: Defines the content of the Web Component.

slots.name: footer
slots.description: Defines the footer HTML Element.

slots.name: header
slots.description: Defines the header HTML Element.

events.name: afterClose
events.description: Fired after the component is closed.

events.name: afterOpen
events.description: Fired after the component is opened.

events.name: beforeClose

parameters.name: escPressed
parameters.description: Indicates that ESC key has triggered the event.

events.description: Fired before the component is closed.

events.name: beforeOpen
events.description: Fired before the component is opened.

parameters.name: opener
parameters.description: the element that the popover is opened by

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Popup
symbols.description:
Overview

Represents a base class for all popup Web Components.

properties.name: headerText
properties.description:
Defines the header text.

Note: If header slot is provided, the headerText is ignored.

properties.name: initialFocus
properties.description: Defines the ID of the HTML Element, which will get the initial focus.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Defines the content of the Web Component.

slots.name: footer
slots.description: Defines the footer HTML Element.

slots.name: header
slots.description: Defines the header HTML Element.

events.name: afterClose
events.description: Fired after the component is closed.

events.name: afterOpen
events.description: Fired after the component is opened.

events.name: beforeClose

parameters.name: escPressed
parameters.description: Indicates that ESC key has triggered the event.

events.description: Fired before the component is closed.

events.name: beforeOpen
events.description: Fired before the component is opened.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.RadioButton
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-radibutton component enables users to select a single option from a set of options. When a ui5-radiobutton is selected by the user, the select event is fired. When a ui5-radiobutton that is within a group is selected, the one that was previously selected gets automatically deselected. You can group radio buttons by using the name property.
Note: If ui5-radiobutton is not part of a group, it can be selected once, but can not be deselected back.

Keyboard Handling

Once the ui5-radiobutton is on focus, it might be selected by pressing the Space and Enter keys.
The Arrow Down/Arrow Up and Arrow Left/Arrow Right keys can be used to change selection between next/previous radio buttons in one group, while TAB and SHIFT + TAB can be used to enter or leave the radio button group.
Note: On entering radio button group, the focus goes to the currently selected radio button.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/RadioButton";

properties.name: disabled
properties.description:
Determines whether the ui5-radiobutton is disabled.

Note: A disabled ui5-radiobutton is completely noninteractive.

properties.name: name
properties.description:
Defines the name of the ui5-radiobutton. Radio buttons with the same name will form a radio button group.

Note: The selection can be changed with ARROW_UP/DOWN and ARROW_LEFT/RIGHT keys between radio buttons in same group.

Note: Only one radio button can be selected per group.

Important: For the name property to have effect when submitting forms, you must add the following import to your project: import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputElementsFormSupport.js";

Note: When set, a native input HTML element will be created inside the ui5-radiobutton so that it can be submitted as part of an HTML form.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description:
Determines whether the ui5-radiobutton is read-only.

Note: A read-only ui5-radiobutton is not editable, but still provides visual feedback upon user interaction.

properties.name: selected
properties.description:
Determines whether the ui5-radiobutton is selected or not.

Note: The property value can be changed with user interaction, either by cliking/tapping on the ui5-radiobutton, or by using the Space or Enter key.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Defines the text of the ui5-radiobutton.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
Defines the form value of the ui5-radiobutton. When a form with a radio button group is submitted, the group's value will be the value of the currently selected radio button.
Important: For the value property to have effect, you must add the following import to your project: import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputElementsFormSupport.js";

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Defines the value state of the ui5-radiobutton.

Available options are:
  • None
  • Error
  • Warning

properties.name: wrap
properties.description:
Defines whether the ui5-radiobutton text wraps when there is not enough space.

Note: By default, the text truncates when there is not enough space.

events.name: select
events.description: Fired when the ui5-radiobutton selected state changes.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.ResponsivePopover
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-responsive-popover acts as a Popover on desktop and tablet, while on phone it acts as a Dialog. The component improves tremendously the user experience on mobile.

Usage

Use it when you want to make sure that all the content is visible on any device.

methods.name: open

parameters.name: opener
parameters.description: the element that the popover is opened by

methods.description: Opens popover on desktop and dialog on mobile.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.SegmentedButton
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-segmentedbutton shows a group of buttons. When the user clicks or taps one of the buttons, it stays in a pressed state. It automatically resizes the buttons to fit proportionally within the component. When no width is set, the component uses the available width.

Note: There can be just one selected button at a time.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/SegmentedButton";

properties.name: selectedButton
properties.description: Currently selected button.

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the buttons of ui5-segmentedbutton.

Note: Multiple buttons are allowed.

Note: Use the ui5-togglebutton for the intended design.

events.name: selectionChange

parameters.name: selectedButton
parameters.description: the pressed button.

events.description: Fired when the selected button changes.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Select
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-select component is used to create a drop-down list. The items inside the ui5-select define the available options by using the ui5-option component.

Keyboard Handling

The ui5-select provides advanced keyboard handling. If the ui5-select is focused, you can open or close the drop-down by pressing F4, ALT+UP or ALT+DOWN keys. Once the drop-down is opened, you can use the UP and DOWN arrow keys to navigate through the available options and select one by pressing the Space or Enter keys.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Select";
import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Option";

properties.name: disabled
properties.description:
Defines whether ui5-select is in disabled state.

Note: A disabled ui5-select is noninteractive.

properties.name: name
properties.description:
Determines the name with which the ui5-select will be submitted in an HTML form. The value of the ui5-select will be the value of the currently selected ui5-option.

Important: For the name property to have effect, you must add the following import to your project: import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputElementsFormSupport.js";

Note: When set, a native input HTML element will be created inside the ui5-select so that it can be submitted as part of an HTML form. Do not use this property unless you need to submit a form.

properties.name: selectedOption
properties.description: Currently selected option.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Defines the value state of the ui5-select.

Available options are:
  • None
  • Error
  • Warning
  • Success
  • Information

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the ui5-select options.

Note: Only one selected option is allowed. If more than one option is defined as selected, the last one would be considered as the selected one.

Note: Use the ui5-option component to define the desired options.

events.name: change

parameters.name: selectedOption
parameters.description: the selected option.

events.description: Fired when the selected option changes.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.StandardListItem
symbols.description: The ui5-li represents the simplest type of item for a ui5-list. This is a list item, providing the most common use cases such as text, image and icon.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Defines the description displayed right under the item text, if such is present.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Defines the icon source URI.

Note: SAP-icons font provides numerous buil-in icons. To find all the available icons, see the Icon Explorer.

properties.name: iconEnd
properties.description:
Defines whether the icon should be displayed in the beginning of the list item or in the end.

Note: If image is set, the icon would be displayed after the image.

properties.name: image
properties.description:
Defines the image source URI.

Note: The image would be displayed in the beginning of the list item.

properties.name: info
properties.description: Defines the info, displayed in the end of the list item.

properties.name: infoState
properties.description:
Defines the state of the info.
Available options are: "None" (by default), "Success", "Warning" and "Erorr".

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the text of the ui5-li.

Note: Аlthough this slot accepts HTML Elements, it is strongly recommended that you only use text in order to preserve the intended design.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.SuggestionItem
symbols.description: The ui5-suggestion-item represents the suggestion item of the ui5-input.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Defines the description displayed right under the item text, if such is present.

properties.name: group
properties.description:
Defines the item to be displayed as a group item.

Note: When set, the other properties, such as image, icon, description, etc. will be omitted and only the text will be displayed.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Defines the icon source URI.

Note: SAP-icons font provides numerous buil-in icons. To find all the available icons, see the Icon Explorer.

properties.name: iconEnd
properties.description:
Defines whether the icon should be displayed in the beginning of the item or in the end.

Note: If image is set, the icon would be displayed after the image.

properties.name: image
properties.description:
Defines the image source URI.

Note: The image would be displayed in the beginning of the item.

properties.name: info
properties.description: Defines the info, displayed in the end of the item.

properties.name: infoState
properties.description:
Defines the state of the info.

Available options are: "None" (by default), "Success", "Warning" and "Erorr".

properties.name: text
properties.description: Defines the text of the ui5-suggestion-item.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Switch
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-switch component is used for changing between binary states.
The component can display texts, that will be switched, based on the component state, via the textOn and textOff properties, but texts longer than 3 letters will be cutted off.
However, users are able to customize the width of ui5-switch with pure CSS (<ui5-switch style="width: 200px">), and set widths, depending on the texts they would use.
Note: the component would not automatically stretch to fit the whole text width.

Keyboard Handling

The state can be changed by pressing the Space and Enter keys.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Switch";

properties.name: checked
properties.description:
Defines if the ui5-switch is checked.

Note: The property can be changed with user interaction, either by cliking/tapping on the ui5-switch, or by pressing the Enter or Space key.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description:
Defines whether the ui5-switch is disabled.

Note: A disabled ui5-switch is noninteractive.

properties.name: graphical
properties.description:
Defines the ui5-switch type.

Note: If graphical type is set, positive and negative icons will replace the textOn and textOff.

properties.name: textOff
properties.description:
Defines the text of the ui5-switch when switched off.

Note: We recommend using short texts, up to 3 letters (larger texts would be cut off).

properties.name: textOn
properties.description:
Defines the text of the ui5-switch when switched on.

Note: We recommend using short texts, up to 3 letters (larger texts would be cut off).

events.name: change
events.description: Fired when the ui5-switch checked state changes.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Tab
symbols.description: The ui5-tab represents a selectable item inside a ui5-tabcontainer. It defines both the item in the tab strip (top part of the ui5-tabcontainer) and the content that is presented to the user once the tab is selected.

properties.name: additionalText
properties.description: Represents the "additionalText" text, which is displayed in the tab filter.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Enabled items can be selected.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Defines the icon source URI to be displayed as graphical element within the ui5-tab. The SAP-icons font provides numerous built-in icons. See all the available icons in the Icon Explorer.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Specifies if the ui5-tab is selected.

properties.name: semanticColor
properties.description:
Defines the ui5-tab semantic color.

The color is applied to:
  • the ui5-tab icon
  • the text when ui5-tab overflows
  • the tab selection line


Available semantic colors are: "Default", "Neutral", "Positive", "Critical" and "Negative".

Note: The color value depends on the current theme.

properties.name: text
properties.description: The text to be displayed for the item.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Defines the tab content.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.TabContainer
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-tabcontainer represents a collection of tabs with associated content. Navigation through the tabs changes the content display of the currently active content area. A tab can be labeled with text only, or icons with text.

Structure

The ui5-tabcontainer can hold two types of entities:
  • ui5-tab - contains all the information on an item (text and icon)
  • ui5-tab-separator - used to separate tabs with a vertical line

ES6 import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/TabContainer";
import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Tab"; (for ui5-tab)
import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/TabSeparator"; (for ui5-tab-separator)

properties.name: collapsed
properties.description: Defines whether the tab content is collapsed.

properties.name: fixed
properties.description: Defines whether the tabs are in a fixed state that is not expandable/collapsible by user interaction.

properties.name: showOverflow
properties.description:
Defines whether the overflow select list is displayed.

The overflow select list represents a list, where all tab filters are displayed so that it's easier for the user to select a specific tab filter.

properties.name: tabLayout
properties.description:
Defines the alignment of the main text and the additionalText of a tab.

Note: The main text and the additionalText would be displayed vertically by defualt, but when set to Inline, they would be displayed horizontally.

Available options are:
  • Standard
  • Inline

properties.name: tabsPlacement
properties.description:
Defines the placement of the tab strip (tab buttons area) relative to the actual tabs' content.

Note: By default the tab strip is displayed above the tabs' content area and this is the recommended layout for most scenarios. Set to Bottom only when the ui5-tabcontainer is at the bottom of the page and you want the tab strip to act as a menu.

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the tabs.

Note: Use ui5-tab and ui5-tab-separator for the intended design.

events.name: tabSelect

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: The selected tab.

parameters.name: tabIndex
parameters.description: The selected tab index.

events.description: Fired when a tab is selected.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.Table
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-table component provides a set of sophisticated and convenient functions for responsive table design. It provides a comprehensive set of features for displaying and dealing with vast amounts of data.

To render the Table properly, the order of the columns should match with the order of the item cells in the rows.

Desktop and tablet devices are supported. On tablets, special consideration should be given to the number of visible columns and rows due to the limited performance of some devices.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Table.js";
import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/TableColumn.js"; (for ui5-table-column)
import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/TableRow.js"; (for ui5-table-row)
import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/TableCell.js"; (for ui5-table-cell)

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description: Defines the text that will be displayed when there is no data and showNoData is present.

properties.name: showNoData
properties.description: Defines if the value of noDataText will be diplayed when there is no rows present in the table.

properties.name: stickyColumnHeader
properties.description:
Determines whether the column headers remain fixed at the top of the page during vertical scrolling as long as the Web Component is in the viewport.

Limitations:
  • Browsers that do not support this feature:
    • Internet Explorer
    • Microsoft Edge lower than version 41 (EdgeHTML 16)
    • Mozilla Firefox lower than version 59
  • Scrolling behavior:
    • If the Web Component is placed in layout containers that have the overflow: hidden or overflow: auto style definition, this can prevent the sticky elements of the Web Component from becoming fixed at the top of the viewport.

slots.name: columns
slots.description:
Defines the configuration for the columns of the ui5-table.

Note: Use ui5-table-column for the intended design.

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the ui5-table rows.

Note: Use ui5-table-row for the intended design.

events.name: popinChange

parameters.name: poppedColumns
parameters.description: popped-in columns.

events.description: Fired when the ui5-table-column is shown as a pop-in instead of hiding it.

events.name: rowClick

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: the clicked row.

events.description: Fired when a row is clicked.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.TableCell
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-table-cell component defines the structure of the data in a single ui5-table cell.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Specifies the content of the ui5-table-cell.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.TableColumn
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-table-column component allows to define column specific properties that are applied when rendering the ui5-table component.

properties.name: demandPopin
properties.description:
According to your minWidth settings, the ui5-table-column can be hidden in different screen sizes.

Setting this property to true, shows this column as pop-in instead of hiding it.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description:
Defines the minimum table width required to display this column. By default it is always displayed.

The responsive behavior of the ui5-table is determined by this property. As an example, by setting minWidth property to 40em shows this column on tablet (and desktop) but hides it on mobile.
For further responsive design options, see demandPopin property.

properties.name: popinText
properties.description: The text for the column when it pops in.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Defines the content of the column header.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.TableRow
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-table-row component represents a row in the ui5-table.

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the cells of the ui5-table-row.

Note: Use ui5-table-cell for the intended design.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.TabSeparator
symbols.description: The ui5-tab-separator represents a vertical line to separate tabs inside a ui5-tabcontainer.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.main.TextArea
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-textarea component provides large spaces for text entries in the form of multiple rows. It has the functionality of the TextField with the additional functionality for multiline texts.
